abstract.p: Standard & Poor's, only credit rating agency to maintain triple-A rating on Japan's sovereign debt, expresses concern that Japanese government's decision to bail out Sogo Co, struggling department store operator, will harm country on its road to financial reform (S)

block.p: The credit rating agency Standard & Poor's panned the Japanese government's decision to bail out a struggling department store operator, the Sogo Company, calling it ''a potentially hazardous twist on Japan's road to financial reform.'' The agency, which has maintained its triple-A rating on Japan's sovereign debt while its competitors Moody's Investors Service and Fitch IBCA have downgraded it, said the government's forgiveness of some 97 billion yen in Sogo debt would sharply decrease pressure on the company to overhaul its operations.
